DOC.brief_summary: This is a comparative study to investigate the safety and efficacy of fidaxomicin versus vancomycin in subjects with Clostridium difficile-Associated Diarrhea (CDAD).
DOC.brief_title: Fidaxomicin Versus Vancomycin for the Treatment of Clostridium Difficile-Associated Diarrhea (CDAD) (MK-5119-018)
DOC.detailed_description: The primary objective of this pivotal study is to investigate the safety and efficacy of fidaxomicin versus vancomycin in subjects with Clostridium difficile-associated diarrhea (CDAD). The cure rates at end of therapy and recurrence rates will be evaluated and compared.
DOC.criteria: Males/females with CDAD Females must use adequate contraception Signed informed consent Lifethreatening CDAD Toxic megacolon Pregnant Concurrent use of diarrheal agents Participation in other trials
